summary: This is an FBI Daily News Briefing from April 19, 2023, summarizing major news stories, including criminal investigations, counterterrorism, and counterintelligence. A key item relevant to the Epstein case is the report that JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon has been ordered to give a deposition in lawsuits related to Jeffrey Epstein's sex trafficking.

persons.name: Jamie Dimon
persons.context: Ordered by a federal judge to undergo up to two days of deposition questioning in lawsuits alleging JPMorgan's liability in Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of teenage girls and women.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the subject of lawsuits against JPMorgan Chase, which allege the bank should have seen evidence of his sex trafficking and avoided profiting from it.

persons.name: Jed Rakoff
persons.context: The Manhattan judge who ordered Jamie Dimon to be deposed for up to two days in the Epstein-related lawsuits.

connections.description: Dimon is the CEO of JPMorgan Chase, a bank being sued for allegedly facilitating and profiting from Epstein's sex trafficking activities.

events.title: Judge Orders Dimon Deposition in Epstein Suit
events.description: Federal Judge Jed Rakoff ordered JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon to undergo up to two days of deposition testimony in lawsuits over the bank's potential liability in Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse.

keyFacts: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon has been ordered by a federal judge to give a deposition in lawsuits related to Jeffrey Epstein's sex trafficking.
The lawsuits, brought by the U.S. Virgin Islands and two anonymous women, contend JPMorgan should have seen evidence of Epstein's sex trafficking and avoided profiting from it.
The document is an FBI Daily News Briefing, indicating the FBI's internal tracking of this high-profile civil litigation.
The briefing covers a wide range of other news unrelated to Epstein, including other criminal investigations, counterterrorism, and international events.
The judge indicated one day of testimony might be sufficient, but approved a potential second day if needed.
